intro: Reevesia pubescens var. siamensis, commonly known as the Siam Reevesia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers and hairy, ovate leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
